command.prompt:
Generate one new attribute for a table of information about mythical creatures. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes to not generate is:
Word;Definition;Synonyms;Origin

Generate a real attribute. Do not generate a fictional one. Here is the semi-colon-separated table by semantic key only:
Word
Satyr
Chimera
Basilisk
Minotaur
Cyclops
Unicorns
Pegasus
Centaur
Gorgon
Phoenix
Hydra
Cerberus
Nymph
Mermaid, half-human, half-fish creature
Dragon, large, serpent-like creature
Griffin
Sphinx
Harpy
Siren
Djinn
Wendigo

Generate values of real data for all existing rows of the table. Generate and output a new table, including the header, with only the attributes Word, and the new attribute in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.output_table:
Word;Lifespan
Satyr;Immortal
Chimera;Unknown
Basilisk;Minutes to hours
Minotaur;Decades
Cyclops;Centuries
Unicorns;Thousands of years
Pegasus;Centuries
Centaur;Centuries
Gorgon;Immortal
Phoenix;Immortal, reborn through self-immolation
Hydra;Immortal
Cerberus;Immortal
Nymph;Immortal
Mermaid, half-human, half-fish creature;Decades
Dragon, large, serpent-like creature;Thousands of years
Griffin;Centuries
Sphinx;Immortal
Harpy;Decades
Siren;Decades
Djinn;Immortal
Wendigo;Indefinite, tied to cannibalism
command.epilogue: The lifespan of mythical creatures is based on various mythological sources and interpretations. Immortal creatures, such as Satyrs, Gorgons, and Djinn, live forever unless killed. Some creatures, like the Basilisk, have short lifespans, lasting only minutes to hours. Others, like Mermaids and Harpies, live for decades. Unicorns and Dragons are said to live for thousands of years. Centaurs, Cyclops, and Griffins have lifespans similar to humans, living for centuries. The Phoenix is unique, as it is reborn through self-immolation, making its lifespan effectively immortal. The Wendigo's lifespan is tied to its existence, which is sustained by cannibalism, making it indefinite. The Hydra is also considered immortal due to its ability to regenerate lost heads. The Lifespan of the Chimera is unknown, as it is not specified in most mythological accounts.
